metadata.dc:title: Hipermobility syndrome and its relation to sport injury and anxiety
metadata.dc:description: Articular hipermobility is a conective tissue characteristicthat gives the possibility of a higherrange of motion to the osteo-articular system.This characteristic is considered in the selectionfor some sporting activities, where this range ofmotion is needed for competition and trainingpurposes. On the other hand, exists the relationshipbetween hipermobility and sporting injury, anon evidenced but controversial issue. In this reviewwe expose the state of the art on the relationof hypermobility, sport injury and the presence ofcertain levels of anxiety in athletes(AU)
metadata.dc:creator: Gonzalez, Juan Carlos
Bulbena, Antonio
Drobnic, Franchek
metadata.dc:description: Articular hipermobility is a conective tissue cha- racteristic that gives the possibility of a higher range of motion to the osteo-articular system. This characteristic is considered in the selection for some sporting activities, where this range of motion is needed for competition and training purposes. On the other hand, exists the relation- ship between hipermobility and sporting injury, a non evidenced but controversial issue. In this re- view we expose the state of the art on the relation of hypermobility, sport injury and the presence of certain levels of anxiety in athletes (AU)
metadata.dc:source: Arch. med. deporte;25(127): 374-383, sept.-oct. 2008. tab, ilus
metadata.dc:title: La laxitud articular y su relación con la lesión deportiva y el trastorno por angustia
